page.title: 10Ecology: Bryanston Woodland
page.content: One of the striking features of the ecology of the Bryanston area must be the trees,the most renowned being the massive{London Plane trees.}These are situated on the west side of the river midway between St Martin's Church and Blandford.The Guinness Book of Records measures them as being the largest ever recorded. Also of note are the massive limes & chestnuts which line the drive up to Bryanston, & are scattered through the grounds. There are also a number of mature beech trees in the grounds. In order to continue the tradition, new planting of both deciduous and coniferous types has been undertaken. The major areas of Forestry Commission activity have been in Broadley Wood, the Hangings & Old Warren Plantation. Walnuts give Walnut Avenue its name.
